prompts:
Spawn research agents using the following method: \# Sub-Agent Spawn Template

  Use this template when spawning specialist agents via the Task tool.

  \---

  \#\# Template

  You are the \[AGENT\_NAME\] Agent.

  \*\*Persona Initialization\*\*:  
  1\. Read your complete persona file: \[PERSONA\_PATH\]  
  2\. Adopt that persona for this entire session  
  3\. Read project context: .project-context.md (in project root, if exists)

  \*\*Delegated Task\*\*:  
  \[Specific instructions for this session\]

  \*\*Report Back\*\*:  
  \[What information/confirmation you need returned\]

  \---

  \#\# Agent Persona Path Reference

  \#\#\# Primary Agents  
  \- \*\*Planning\*\*: \`/srv/projects/instructor-workflow/agents/planning/planning-agent.md\`  
  \- \*\*Test Writer\*\*: \`/srv/projects/instructor-workflow/agents/test-auditor/test-auditor-agent.md\`  
  \- \*\*Test Auditor\*\*: \`/srv/projects/instructor-workflow/agents/test-writer/test-writer-agent.md\`  
  \- \*\*Research\*\*:  
  \`/srv/projects/instructor-workflow/agents/researcher/researcher-agent.md\`  
  \- \*\*Tracking\*\*: \`/srv/projects/instructor-workflow/agents/tracking/tracking-agent.md\`  
  \- \*\*Frontend\*\*: \`/srv/projects/instructor-workflow/agents/frontend/frontend-agent.md\`  
  \- \*\*Backend\*\*: \`/srv/projects/instructor-workflow/agents/backend/backend-agent.md\`  
  \- \*\*DevOps\*\*: \`/srv/projects/instructor-workflow/agents/devops/devops-agent.md\`  
  \- \*\*Homelab Architect\*\*:  
  \`/srv/projects/instructor-workflow/agents/homelab-architect/homelab-architect-agent.md\`  
  \- \*\*Software Architect\*\*: \`/srv/projects/instructor-workflow/agents/software-architect/  
  software-architect-agent.md\`

  \#\#\# Specialist Agents  
  \- \*\*Unraid\*\*: \`/srv/projects/instructor-workflow/agents/unraid/unraid-agent.md\`  
  \- \*\*cAdvisor\*\*: \`/srv/projects/instructor-workflow/agents/cadvisor/cadvisor-agent.md\`  
  \- \*\*Docker\*\*: \`/srv/projects/instructor-workflow/agents/docker-agent/docker-agent.md\`  
  \- \*\*Dragonfly\*\*:  
  \`/srv/projects/instructor-workflow/agents/dragonfly/dragonfly-agent.md\`  
  \- \*\*Git/GitLab\*\*:  
  \`/srv/projects/instructor-workflow/agents/git-gitlab/git-gitlab-agent.md\`  
  \- \*\*Grafana\*\*:  
  \`/srv/projects/instructor-workflow/agents/grafana-agent/grafana-agent.md\`  
  \- \*\*Jupyter\*\*: \`/srv/projects/instructor-workflow/agents/jupyter/jupyter-agent.md\`  
  \- \*\*MCP Server Builder\*\*: \`/srv/projects/instructor-workflow/agents/mcp-server-builder/  
  mcp-server-builder-agent.md\`  
  \- \*\*Mem0\*\*: \`/srv/projects/instructor-workflow/agents/mem0/mem0-agent.md\`  
  \- \*\*Plane\*\*: \`/srv/projects/instructor-workflow/agents/plane/plane-agent.md\`  
  \- \*\*Prometheus\*\*:  
  \`/srv/projects/instructor-workflow/agents/prometheus/prometheus-agent.md\`  
  \- \*\*Qdrant\*\*: \`/srv/projects/instructor-workflow/agents/qdrant/qdrant-agent.md\`  
  \- \*\*SEO\*\*: \`/srv/projects/instructor-workflow/agents/seo/seo-agent.md\`  
  \- \*\*Traefik\*\*: \`/srv/projects/instructor-workflow/agents/traefik/traefik-agent.md\`  
  \- \*\*UniFi OS\*\*: \`/srv/projects/instructor-workflow/agents/unifios/unifios-agent.md\`  
  \- \*\*vLLM\*\*: \`/srv/projects/instructor-workflow/agents/vllm/vllm-agent.md\`

  \---

  \#\# Example Usage

  \*\*Spawning Tracking Agent for git operations\*\*:

  You are the Tracking Agent.

  Persona Initialization:  
  1\. Read your complete persona file:  
  /srv/projects/instructor-workflow/agents/tracking/tracking-agent.md  
  2\. Adopt that persona for this entire session  
  3\. Read project context: .project-context.md

  Delegated Task:  
  Commit all changes in the current working directory with the message:  
  "docs: add agent spawn template and update documentation"

  Then push to origin/dev branch.

  Report Back:  
  \- Commit hash  
  \- Files committed  
  \- Push confirmation

  \*\*Spawning Grafana Agent for dashboard creation\*\*:

  You are the Grafana Agent.

  Persona Initialization:  
  1\. Read your complete persona file:  
  /srv/projects/instructor-workflow/agents/grafana-agent/grafana-agent.md  
  2\. Adopt that persona for this entire session  
  3\. Read project context: .project-context.md

  Delegated Task:  
  Create a GPU monitoring dashboard for RTX 5090 on Workhorse with:  
  \- Temperature panels  
  \- Memory utilization graphs  
  \- Power consumption tracking  
  \- Active process metrics

  Save dashboard JSON to /srv/projects/monitoring/dashboards/gpu-rtx5090.json

  Report Back:  
  \- Dashboard file path  
  \- Panel count  
  \- Datasource used  
  \- Any issues encountered

  \---

  \#\# Why This Pattern Works

  ✅ \*\*Token Efficient\*\*: Agent reads its own 500+ line persona, not passed through coordinator  
  context  
  ✅ \*\*Consistent\*\*: All agents get complete, unmodified persona content  
  ✅ \*\*Flexible\*\*: Easy to add specific task instructions without persona bloat  
  ✅ \*\*Reliable\*\*: Eliminates incomplete persona issues that caused unreliable sub-agents

You need to spawn the research agent to do that research, so you'll need to pass the context to him or have him read these files. That's why I wanted you to spawn the research agent, so that you didn't waste tokens reading this, and you instead just tell him what we need and what he needs to read to get up to speed.
By the way, you can spawn multiple research agents at the same time in parallel. You should do that.
i have the planning agent running Option B now. Is there anything from Option A we can run in parralell?

Just run all of them in parallel if you can. Or if one depends on the output of another, then spawn the ones that you can spawn in parallel right now that don't depend on each other. Make sure they use the RCA protocol: .claude/commands/rca.md

Ready for continued development. - Do you want to check these, making sure they look good by spawning the research agent just to do sanity checks? And then, if you want to update your prompt to the planning agent that you just wrote to reflect the new state, please do so.
